Speaker: weir
Dialogue: I miss you.

Speaker: weir
Dialogue: You wanted to see me, Admiral?

Speaker: hollis
Dialogue: I apologize for the short notice, Bill, but we've had something come up that requires your immediate attention. Lyle?

Speaker: lyle
Dialogue: At oh-three-hundred this morning, TDRSS picked up an automated navigation beacon broadcasting at two minute intervals in Neptune orbit.

Speaker: weir
Dialogue: Incredible... These are the same coordinates before the ship disappeared... this, this happened? This isn't some kind of hoax?

Speaker: hollis
Dialogue: I wouldn't bring you here on a hoax. Houston confirms the telemetry and I.D. codes.

Speaker: weir
Dialogue: It's the Event Horizon. She's come back.

Speaker: hollis
Dialogue: That ship was lost in deep space, seven years ago. If the Titanic sailed into New York harbor, I'd find it more plausible.  We need you to prepare a detailed briefing on the ship's systems for the salvage crew...

Speaker: weir
Dialogue: A written briefing can't possibly anticipate the variables on a mission like this. I have to go with them.

Speaker: lyle
Dialogue: Dr. Weir, you have no experience with salvage procedures.

Speaker: weir
Dialogue: I designed the ship's propulsion system. I am the only person capable of evaluating the performance of the gravity drive. You can't send a Search and Rescue team out there alone and expect them to succeed. That would be like... like sending an auto- mechanic to work on the shuttle.

Speaker: lyle
Dialogue: I can understand your desire to redeem your reputation, Dr. Weir, but it doesn't factor into this.

Speaker: weir
Dialogue: This is not about my reputation! This is not about me at all!  I have to go.

Speaker: hollis
Dialogue: It's not that simple.  Lyle, play the recording for Dr. Weir.

Speaker: lyle
Dialogue: Navigation Control tried to hail the vessel. This was the only response.

Speaker: lyle
Dialogue: Since the initial transmission, there's been no further contact. Just the beacon, every two minutes.

Speaker: weir
Dialogue: The crew? Could they still be alive?

Speaker: lyle
Dialogue: The ship had life support systems for eighteen months. They're been gone seven years.

Speaker: weir
Dialogue: Someone sent that message. Admiral, you have to put me on that ship.

Speaker: hollis
Dialogue: It's against my better judgement, but I'll run this by the Man downstairs. You'll know my decision by the end of the day.

Speaker: weir
Dialogue: Thank you.

Speaker: hollis
Dialogue: Don't thank me, Bill. I'm not doing you any favors.

Speaker: lyle
Dialogue: You're not seriously considering sending him?

Speaker: hollis
Dialogue: You don't just dismiss Bill Weir. The man held Oppenheimer's chair at Princeton. If the Event Horizon had worked, he would have gone down in history as the greatest mind in physics since Einstein.

Speaker: lyle
Dialogue: The official inquiry blamed Weir's design for the ship's loss.

Speaker: hollis
Dialogue: That doesn't mean a damn thing. They were looking for a scapegoat and Weir fit the bill. But he's not responsible for what happened to the ship.

Speaker: lyle
Dialogue: Does he know that?

Speaker: hollis
Dialogue: What's on your mind?

Speaker: lyle
Dialogue: He doesn't belong on this mission. Responsible or not, he blames himself. He's too close to it.  And then there's his wife.

Speaker: hollis
Dialogue: It's been two years since she died. He's over it.

Speaker: lyle
Dialogue: Some things you don't get over.

Speaker: hollis
Dialogue: I want our best people on this. Where's Miller?

Speaker: lyle
Dialogue: The Lewis and Clark just returned from patrol in the asteroid belt, she's docked in bay four.

Speaker: smith
Dialogue: I can't believe this, I haven't gotten more than my hand in six weeks and now this shit. Why not Mars, Cap, Mars has women...

Speaker: starck
Dialogue: Smith's right. Neptune? There's nothing out there. If something happens, we'll be on our own.

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: I don't like it either, but you know the rules: we get the call, we go. Is the course locked in?

Speaker: smith
Dialogue: Locked and cocked.

Speaker: starck
Dialogue: We're past the outer marker, we can engage the ion drive whenever you're ready.

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: Justin?

Speaker: justin
Dialogue: Everything green on my boards, Skipper.

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: Start the countdown.

Speaker: starck
Dialogue: Ion drive will engage in... T-minus ten minutes.

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: Let's go.

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: Kill it.

Speaker: cooper
Dialogue: Time to play Spam in the can.

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: Don't start with me, Cooper.

Speaker: weir
Dialogue: Captain Miller, I just want to say...

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: The clock is running, Dr. Weir. If you'll follow the rest of the crew, they'll show you to the gravity tanks.

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: What's the hold up?

Speaker: peters
Dialogue: Just loading the last of the CO2 scrubbers.  Good for four months.

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: I put in for a replacement for you but no one...

Speaker: peters
Dialogue: No, no, its alright. I talked to my ex, he'll keep Denny over Christmas and I'll get him this summer.  Goddam it, Skipper... I haven't seen him in two months.

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: I am sorry. But now we have to go to work.

Speaker: cooper
Dialogue: Is that an offer?

Speaker: starck
Dialogue: It is not.

Speaker: weir
Dialogue: Captain Miller, I appreciate this opportunity...

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: Doctor Weir, my crew is not going on your mission because we want to. We were pulled off a well deserved leave, to be sent out to the middle of nowhere, and no one's even told us why.

Speaker: weir
Dialogue: I've been authorized to brief you and the crew once we reach Neptune space.

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: Until then, do what you're told and stay out of my way.

Speaker: peters
Dialogue: First time in a grav couch?

Speaker: weir
Dialogue: Yes.

Speaker: peters
Dialogue: Don't worry about it. He's hard, but he's fair. You're lucky to be shipping out with him. He's one of the few Captains in the service with experience in the Outer Reach.

Speaker: weir
Dialogue: He's been past Mars?

Speaker: peters
Dialogue: He served on the Goliath.

Speaker: weir
Dialogue: Wasn't that ship destroyed?

Speaker: peters
Dialogue: They attempted to rescue a supply shuttle bound for Titan. The shuttle's oh-two tanks ruptured during the rescue, flooded both ships with pure oxygen. There was a spark and both ships were incinerated. The Skipper and three others just made it to a lifeboat. Captain Miller was able...

Speaker: dj
Dialogue: He doesn't like to talk about it.

Speaker: dj
Dialogue: You didn't eat anything in the past twelve hours?

Speaker: dj
Dialogue: When the Ion drive fires, we'll be taking about 30 gees. Without a tank, the force would liquefy your skeleton.

Speaker: weir
Dialogue: I've seen the effect on mice.

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: Five minutes.

Speaker: dj
Dialogue: Put this on.

Speaker: peters
Dialogue: You'll be fine. You'll wake up and we'll be there. Watch your fingers.

Speaker: dj
Dialogue: Heart-rate decreasing... body temp dropping to 80... 70... 60... 50... 40 degrees Fahrenheit. He's in stasis.

Speaker: voice
Dialogue: Billy...

Speaker: voice
Dialogue: I'm so cold...

Speaker: voice
Dialogue: I'm so cold...

Speaker: weir
Dialogue: Claire?

Speaker: weir
Dialogue: Claire? I'm sorry. Claire?

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: I'm so cold...

Speaker: weir
Dialogue: Claire...

Speaker: peters
Dialogue: DJ!  It's okay. You're okay. Just breathe.

Speaker: weir
Dialogue: I'm alright now. I'm alright...

Speaker: dj
Dialogue: Move slowly. You've been in stasis for fifty-six days. You're going to experience a little disorientation.

Speaker: cooper
Dialogue: Damn, Dr. Weir, don't scare us like that. Coffee?

Speaker: weir
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: cooper
Dialogue: Coffee.

Speaker: weir
Dialogue: No, thank you.

Speaker: cooper
Dialogue: Hey, Starck. You wanna dry my back?

Speaker: starck
Dialogue: Maybe when you finish puberty.

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: Starck, why aren't you on the bridge?

Speaker: starck
Dialogue: I just finished drying...

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: Then what are you doing here? Come on, people, let's go!  And Cooper... Put some pants on.

Speaker: denny
Dialogue: Play horsey, Mommy, play horsey...

Speaker: smith
Dialogue: 30 hours to Neptune orbit.

Speaker: starck
Dialogue: All boards are green, everything's five by five.

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: That's good to know. Justin, you wanna stow that?

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: Okay, listen up. As you all know by now, we have an addition to our crew. Dr. Weir, this is: Starck, navigation; Smith, pilot, Justin, ship's engineer --

Speaker: cooper
Dialogue: You can call him Baby-bear, he loves that...

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: This is Cooper, what the hell do you do on this ship, anyway?

Speaker: justin
Dialogue: Ballast.

Speaker: cooper
Dialogue: I am your best friend. I am a lifesaver and a heartbreaker...

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: He's a rescue technician. Peters, medical technician. DJ...

Speaker: dj
Dialogue: Trauma.

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: And this is mission specialist Dr. William Weir. We all know where we're going. Dr. Weir is going to tell us why.

Speaker: weir
Dialogue: What I am about to tell you is considered code-black by the NSA.

Speaker: justin
Dialogue: That means top-secret, Cooper.

Speaker: cooper
Dialogue: I heard it.

Speaker: weir
Dialogue: The USAC intercepted a radio transmission from a decaying orbit around Neptune. The source has been identified as the Event Horizon.

Speaker: starck
Dialogue: That's impossible! She was lost with all hands, what, seven...

Speaker: justin
Dialogue: Seven years ago, the reactor blew...

Speaker: peters
Dialogue: How can we salvage...?

Speaker: smith
Dialogue: Let the dead rest, man...

Speaker: cooper
Dialogue: ...cancel our leave and send us out on some bullshit mission...!

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: EVERYBODY SHUT UP! Let the man speak.

Speaker: weir
Dialogue: What was made public about the Event Horizon, that she was a deep space research vessel, that its reactor went critical, that the ship blew up... None of that is true.  The Event Horizon was the culmination of a secret government project to create a spacecraft capable of faster- than-light flight.

Speaker: smith
Dialogue: You can't do that.

Speaker: starck
Dialogue: The law of relativity prohibits faster- than-light travel...

Speaker: weir
Dialogue: Relativity, yes. We can't break the law of relativity, but we can go around it. The ship doesn't really move faster than the speed of light; it creates a dimensional gateway that allows the ship to instantaneously "jump" from one point in the universe to another, light years away.

Speaker: starck
Dialogue: How?

Speaker: weir
Dialogue: Well, in layman's terms, you use a rotating magnetic field to focus a narrow beam of gravitons; these in turn fold space-time consistent with Weyl tensor dynamics until the space- time curvature becomes infinitely large and you have a singularity...

Speaker: cooper
Dialogue: Laymen's terms.

Speaker: smith
Dialogue: Hey...

Speaker: weir
Dialogue: Say this paper represents space-time, and you want to get from "point A" here...  Now: what's the shortest distance between two points?

Speaker: starck
Dialogue: A straight line.

Speaker: weir
Dialogue: Wrong. The shortest distance between two points...

Speaker: weir
Dialogue: ...is zero. That's what the singularity does: it folds space, so that point A and point B coexist in the same space and time. After the ship passes through this gateway, space returns to normal.  It's called a gravity drive.

Speaker: justin
Dialogue: How do you know all this?

Speaker: weir
Dialogue: I built it.

Speaker: cooper
Dialogue: I can see why they sent you along.

Speaker: justin
Dialogue: So if the ship didn't blow up, what happened?

Speaker: weir
Dialogue: It was the ship's maiden voyage, to test the drive. The Event Horizon moved to safe distance using ion thrusters. They received the go-ahead to activate the gravity drive.  Until now.

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: Where has it been for the last seven years?

Speaker: weir
Dialogue: That's what we're here to find out.

Speaker: weir
Dialogue: We haven't been able to confirm any live contact, but TDRSS did receive a single transmission from the Event Horizon.

Speaker: smith
Dialogue: What the hell is that?

Speaker: peters
Dialogue: It doesn't sound like anything human.

Speaker: weir
Dialogue: Houston has passed the recording through several filters and isolated what appears to be a human voice.

Speaker: smith
Dialogue: Jesus...

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: What is that?

Speaker: dj
Dialogue: It sounds like Latin.

Speaker: cooper
Dialogue: Latin? Who the fuck speaks Latin?

Speaker: starck
Dialogue: No one. It's a dead language.

Speaker: dj
Dialogue: Mostly dead.

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: What does it say?

Speaker: weir
Dialogue: NSA encryption specialists have deciphered some of the message...

Speaker: weir
Dialogue: There: "...liberatis me..." They haven't been able to translate the rest, it's too distorted.

Speaker: dj
Dialogue: "Liberatis me." "Save me."

Speaker: cooper
Dialogue: From what?

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: You're convinced the crew could still be alive? After seven years?

Speaker: weir
Dialogue: The Event Horizon only had life support for eighteen months. It seems impossible, but in light of the transmission... I have to think that someone has managed to endure until now.

Speaker: cooper
Dialogue: Skipper, do we get hazard pay for this?

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: You heard the tape, Smith. We're looking for survivors.

Speaker: starck
Dialogue: Crossing the horizon. Optimum approach angle is fourteen degrees.

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: Come around to three-three-four...

Speaker: smith
Dialogue: Heading three-three-four...

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: ...Make your approach vector negative fourteen degrees...

Speaker: smith
Dialogue: One-four degrees...

Speaker: smith
Dialogue: We have a lock on the Event Horizon's navigation beacon. It's in the upper ionosphere, we're in for some chop.

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: Bring us in tight. Starck, get on the horn, see if anyone's listening...

Speaker: smith
Dialogue: Matching speed... now. Range to target ten thousand meters and closing... Skipper, I got a bad feeling about this...

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: We're all on edge, Smith. We're a long way out...

Speaker: smith
Dialogue: That's not it. That ship was built to go faster than light... That's just wrong, it goes against everything we know...

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: What are you trying to say? "If God had intended Man to fly, he would have given us wings?"

Speaker: smith
Dialogue: Something like that, yeah.

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: I guess we're about to find out. Keep us slow and steady.

Speaker: smith
Dialogue: Yes, sir.

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: Dr. Weir...!

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: I think you want to see this.

Speaker: weir
Dialogue: Where is she?

Speaker: smith
Dialogue: Dead ahead, 5000 meters.

Speaker: smith
Dialogue: We've got some weather.

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: I noticed. Starck, anybody home?

Speaker: starck
Dialogue: If they are, they're screening their calls.

Speaker: smith
Dialogue: Range 3000 meters and closing.

Speaker: weir
Dialogue: I can't see anything...

Speaker: smith
Dialogue: 1500 meters. We're getting too close...

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: Where is it?

Speaker: starck
Dialogue: The scope is lit, it's right in front of us...

Speaker: smith
Dialogue: 1000 meters...

Speaker: smith
Dialogue: Proximity warning! 900, 800 meters, 700... we're right on top of it, we're gonna hit!

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: Starck...

Speaker: starck
Dialogue: It should be right there...

Speaker: starck
Dialogue: My God.

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: Reverse thrusters full!

Speaker: smith
Dialogue: Jesus, that is one big ugly fat fucker...

Speaker: weir
Dialogue: She's not ugly.

Speaker: smith
Dialogue: Range 500 meters and holding. Turbulence is dropping off...

Speaker: starck
Dialogue: Picking up magnetic interference.

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: Put it through TACS. Smith, you up for a flyby?

Speaker: smith
Dialogue: Love to.

Speaker: starck
Dialogue: Look at the size of that thing.

Speaker: weir
Dialogue: Foredecks. Crew quarters, bridge, medical and science labs, hydroponics, what have you. That central section connects the forward decks to the Engineering containment area. Can we move in closer?

Speaker: smith
Dialogue: Shit, Doc, any closer and we're gonna need a rubber...

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: Do it.

Speaker: weir
Dialogue: That's the engineering containment. And there's the main airlock. We can dock there.

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: Smith, use the arm and lock us onto that antennae cluster.

Speaker: weir
Dialogue: Be careful. It's not a load bearing structure...

Speaker: smith
Dialogue: We're locked in.

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: Starck, give me a read.

Speaker: starck
Dialogue: The reactor's still hot. We've got several small radiation sources, leaks probably. Nothing serious.

Speaker: weir
Dialogue: Do they have pressure?

Speaker: starck
Dialogue: Affirmative. The hull's intact... but there's no gravity and the thermal units are off line. I'm showing deep cold. The crew couldn't survive unless they were in stasis.

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: Find 'em, Starck.

Speaker: starck
Dialogue: Something's wrong with the bio-scan.

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: Radiation interference?

Speaker: starck
Dialogue: There's not enough radiation to throw off the scan. I'm picking up trace life forms, but I can't get a lock on the location.

Speaker: weir
Dialogue: Could it be the crew? If they were in suspended animation, wouldn't that effect the scan?

Speaker: starck
Dialogue: If they were in stasis, I'd get a location, but these readings, they're all over the ship. It doesn't make any sense.

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: Okay. We do it the hard way. Deck by deck, room by room. Starck, deploy the umbilicus. I believe you're up for a walk, Mr. Justin. Go get your bonnet on.

Speaker: justin
Dialogue: Yes, sir!

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: Dr. Weir, I need you on the bridge.

Speaker: weir
Dialogue: Captain, I didn't come out here to sit on your bridge, I need to be on that ship...

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: Once the ship is secured, we'll bring you on board --

Speaker: weir
Dialogue: That is not acceptable --

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: I need you to guide us from the comm station. This is where I need you. Help us to do our job.

Speaker: weir
Dialogue: Very well.

Speaker: cooper
Dialogue: ...come on, Skipper, I already put my shoes on...

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: You've had plenty EVA, Coop, it's Justin's turn. Stay on station. If anything happens...

Speaker: cooper
Dialogue: I'll be all over it.

Speaker: peters
Dialogue: Opening inner airlock door.

Speaker: cooper
Dialogue: You still need the rope? I thought you were one a those spacemen with ice in ya veins.

Speaker: justin
Dialogue: I'd rather be on the rope and not need it than need it and not have it. Now step aside, old man.

Speaker: cooper
Dialogue: You just keep your nose clean, Baby Bear. Clear the door.

Speaker: weir
Dialogue: You've reached the outer airlock door.

Speaker: peters
Dialogue: We've got pressure.

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: Clear and open on my mark. Three... two... one... mark.

Speaker: peters
Dialogue: Jesus its huge.

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: Ice crystals everywhere. This place is a deep freeze.

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: Peters and I will search the forward decks. Justin, take Engineering. No hot-dogging, not on this one, alright?

Speaker: justin
Dialogue: Not a chance, sir.

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: Dr. Weir, what's this?

Speaker: peters
Dialogue: Here's another one. They're all over the place.

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: I can see that, what're they for?

Speaker: weir
Dialogue: In an emergency, the charges detonate in series, destroying the central section and separating the personnel areas from the rest of the ship. That way, if the gravity drive malfunctions, the crew could use the foredecks as a lifeboat.

Speaker: peters
Dialogue: That means they didn't abandon ship.

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: So where are they? Starck, any luck with the bio-scan?

Speaker: starck
Dialogue: I'm running diagnostics now, Skipper... Nothing's wrong with the sensor pack, I'm still getting trace life readings, all over the ship.

Speaker: peters
Dialogue: There's no one in the corridor but us.

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: Peters is right, no one's here.

Speaker: peters
Dialogue: I don't know, this place is really dark, I can't see a thing...

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: Easy, Peters, we're okay, we're okay. Let's finish the sweep.

Speaker: peters
Dialogue: I can see the hatch.

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: Starck, you still showing those readings?

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: Keep your eyes open.

Speaker: peters
Dialogue: We found the gravity couches.

Speaker: weir
Dialogue: Any survivors?

Speaker: weir
Dialogue: No one?

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: They're empty, Dr. Weir. Moving forward.

Speaker: justin
Dialogue: We still have pressure. The radiation count's steady at 7 millirads an hour.

Speaker: peters
Dialogue: Dr. Weir, what's this the door to?

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: If we saw any crew, Doctor, you'd know about it.  I'm in Medical. No casualties, it looks like this place has never been used.

Speaker: peters
Dialogue: I found something.

Speaker: weir
Dialogue: Yes, we can see some kind of mist. What is that?

Speaker: weir
Dialogue: Can you see a body?

Speaker: peters
Dialogue: There's no one here.

Speaker: peters
Dialogue: There's no one here, Skipper.

Speaker: peters
Dialogue: Come on...

Speaker: peters
Dialogue: Okay. I'm on the bridge.

Speaker: peters
Dialogue: Everything's been shut down. Conserving power, I guess. Green light on the hull, it's intact.

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: The science workstation has power, I'll see if I can find the crew from here.

Speaker: weir
Dialogue: Ms. Peters, turn back and to your left, please.

Speaker: starck
Dialogue: What is it?

Speaker: weir
Dialogue: Ship's log.

Speaker: peters
Dialogue: It's stuck.

Speaker: justin
Dialogue: I've reached another containment door. This thing's huge...

Speaker: justin
Dialogue: I'm going in.

Speaker: peters
Dialogue: It's really jammed in there.

Speaker: peters
Dialogue: I found one.

Speaker: peters
Dialogue: Frozen.

Speaker: starck
Dialogue: What happened to his eyes?

Speaker: smith
Dialogue: Explosive decompression.

Speaker: starck
Dialogue: Decompression wouldn't do that.

Speaker: starck
Dialogue: You okay?

Speaker: cooper
Dialogue: Hey, Baby Bear, Mama Bear got a corpsicle for ya...

Speaker: cooper
Dialogue: Justin, do you copy?

Speaker: justin
Dialogue: Uh, yeah Coop, I'm still here.

Speaker: justin
Dialogue: I'm in the Second Containment area. It's pitch black in here. There must have been a coolant leak. Man, this shit is everywhere. I can't see a damn thing.

Speaker: justin
Dialogue: The reactor's still hot. Coolant level is on reserve, but still in the green.

Speaker: justin
Dialogue: I got it...

Speaker: justin
Dialogue: Holy shit...

Speaker: cooper
Dialogue: Justin?

Speaker: justin
Dialogue: I think I found something...

Speaker: smith
Dialogue: What the hell is that?

Speaker: weir
Dialogue: That's the Core: the gravity drive. The heart of the ship.

Speaker: peters
Dialogue: Crystallized.

Speaker: justin
Dialogue: Almost done, I just gotta check one thing...

Speaker: starck
Dialogue: Justin, hold on a sec, you're breaking up...

Speaker: starck
Dialogue: Justin, come in...

Speaker: weir
Dialogue: What is it?

Speaker: starck
Dialogue: I don't know. The life readings just went off the scale.

Speaker: smith
Dialogue: Something's wrong...

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: What the hell...

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: Oh shit...!

Speaker: starck
Dialogue: Miller, do you read me, Peters --

Speaker: smith
Dialogue: Get them back --

Speaker: starck
Dialogue: I'm trying, goddammit --

Speaker: cooper
Dialogue: What's happening?

Speaker: cooper
Dialogue: 350 meters... 400 meters...

Speaker: dj
Dialogue: He's in trouble. Go!

Speaker: cooper
Dialogue: I'm gone!

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: Boarding party, sound off... Peters, do you read me... . Peters...

Speaker: peters
Dialogue: Denny...

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: ...Peters, do you read me...

Speaker: voice
Dialogue: Don't leave me...

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: Justin? Justin, sound off... Justin...!

Speaker: cooper
Dialogue: Hold on, Baby Bear...

Speaker: cooper
Dialogue: Oh my God...

Speaker: cooper
Dialogue: Justin, do you read me? Justin... .

Speaker: cooper
Dialogue: Baby Bear, don't do this. Don't do this...

Speaker: starck
Dialogue: Here comes another one! Hold on!

Speaker: starck
Dialogue: We lost the starboard baffle! The hull's been breached!

Speaker: smith
Dialogue: The safety circuit's failed!

Speaker: weir
Dialogue: We're losing atmosphere...

Speaker: starck
Dialogue: There are pressure suits in the Airlock. Go!

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: Can anybody hear me...

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: Peters...

Speaker: peters
Dialogue: Yeah. I'm -- I'm okay.

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: Coop, where are you...

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: Hold on, Coop...

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: Smith, where the hell have you been?!

Speaker: smith
Dialogue: We have a situation here...

Speaker: smith
Dialogue: We lost the starboard baffle and the hull cracked. Our safety seals didn't close, the circuit's fried --

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: Do we have enough time for a weld?

Speaker: smith
Dialogue: We're losing pressure at 280 liters a second and our oxygen tanks are cracked. In three minutes, our atmosphere will be gone. We are fucking dead.

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: No one's dying on my watch, Smith! What about the reserve tanks?

Speaker: weir
Dialogue: The Event Horizon.

Speaker: smith
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: weir
Dialogue: It still has air and reserve power, we can activate gravity and life support.

Speaker: starck
Dialogue: What if the air has gone bad? We can't wear these suits forever.

Speaker: smith
Dialogue: I don't think this is a good idea, we don't even know what happened on that ship...

Speaker: weir
Dialogue: It beats dying, Mister Smith.

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: Dr. Weir's right. Get on board the Event Horizon. I'll meet you at the airlock.

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: You heard me, Smith. Peters, are you with me?

Speaker: peters
Dialogue: I'm ahead of you. Bringing the thermal units on line...

Speaker: peters
Dialogue: Hold tight and prep for gees.

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: Everybody okay?

Speaker: starck
Dialogue: We're all here.

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: Okay. Let's find out how much time we just bought.

Speaker: dj
Dialogue: We haven't tested the air yet. It could be contaminated...

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: No time. We need whatever's left in our suits to repair the Clark. Like it or not, this is the only oxygen for three billion kilometers.

Speaker: starck
Dialogue: It tastes bad.

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: But you can breathe it.

Speaker: starck
Dialogue: The antennae array's completely fried, we've got no radio, no laser, no highgain... No one's going to be coming to help us.

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: How much oh-two do we have?

Speaker: starck
Dialogue: Oxygen is not the problem.

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: Carbon dioxide?

Speaker: starck
Dialogue: It's building up with every breath we take. And the CO2 filters on the Event Horizon are shot.

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: We can take the filters from the Clark...

Speaker: starck
Dialogue: I thought of that, with the filters from the Clark, we've got enough breathable air for twenty hours. After that, we'd better be on our way home.

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: What about the life readings you picked up?

Speaker: starck
Dialogue: The Event Horizon sensors show the same thing: "Bio-readings of indeterminate origin." Right before that wave hit the Clark, there was some kind of surge, right off the scale, but now it's back to its previous levels.

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: What's causing the readings?

Speaker: starck
Dialogue: I don't know, but whatever it is, it's not the crew.

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: So where is the rest of the crew? We've been over every inch of this ship and all we've found is blood. Dr. Weir? Any suggestions?

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: What happened here?

Speaker: smith
Dialogue: Captain Miller, you copy?

Speaker: smith
Dialogue: I've found a six inch fracture in the outer hull. We should be able to repair it and re-pressurize, it's gonna take some time.

Speaker: smith
Dialogue: Understood.

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: How is he?

Speaker: dj
Dialogue: His vitals are stable, but he's unresponsive to stimuli. He might wake up in fifteen minutes. He might not wake up at all.

Speaker: peters
Dialogue: What happened to him?

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: DJ, take samples from these stains, compare them to medical records, I want to know whose blood this is.

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: Okay, people, there's been a change in the mission. In less than eighteen hours, we will run out of breathable air. Our primary objective is now survival. That means we focus on repairing the Lewis and Clark and salvaging whatever will buy us more time.  Our secondary objective is finding out what happened to this ship and its crew. Two months from now, I fully intend to be standing in front of the good Admiral giving my report, and I'd like to have more than my dick in my hands.

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: Peters, I want you to go through the ship's log, see if we can't find some answers.

Speaker: peters
Dialogue: I can use the station in Medical, keep an eye on Justin...

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: Fine. Starck, I want you to repeat the bio-scan...

Speaker: starck
Dialogue: What's the point? I'll just get the same thing...

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: Not acceptable. I want to know what's causing those readings. If the crew is dead, I want the bodies, I want the crew found.

Speaker: starck
Dialogue: I can reconfigure the scan for C-12, amylase proteins.

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: Do it. Dr. Weir...

Speaker: weir
Dialogue: Yes.

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: One of my men is down. I want to know what happened to him.

Speaker: cooper
Dialogue: I told you. He was inside the Core...

Speaker: cooper
Dialogue: It was like... nothing was there... and then Justin appeared and the Core... became metal...

Speaker: weir
Dialogue: No, he didn't.

Speaker: cooper
Dialogue: You weren't there. I saw it.

Speaker: weir
Dialogue: Saw what, Mr. Cooper? What did you really see, because what you're describing is not physically possible...

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: Cooper! Enough!

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: Dr. Weir, Justin may die. Whatever happened to him could happen to all of us.

Speaker: weir
Dialogue: I don't know what happened to Justin.

Speaker: cooper
Dialogue: I'm telling you, I saw it...

Speaker: weir
Dialogue: What you saw could have been an optical effect caused by gravitational distortion.

Speaker: cooper
Dialogue: I know what I saw and it wasn't a fucking "optical effect!"

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: Hold on, what's this "gravitational distortion?"

Speaker: weir
Dialogue: It's possible that a burst of gravity waves escaped from the Core, distorting space-time. They could be what hit the Lewis and Clark.

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: What could cause them?  What's in the Core?

Speaker: weir
Dialogue: It's complicated...

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: How much time do you need? We have seventeen hours and forty-two minutes. Now: what is in the Core?

Speaker: weir
Dialogue: A black hole.

Speaker: weir
Dialogue: That's how the gravity drive works, you see: it focuses the black hole's immense gravitational power to create the gateway. That's how the Event Horizon travels faster than light.

Speaker: starck
Dialogue: I can't believe we built this.

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: It's insane.

Speaker: weir
Dialogue: "Insane?" The finest astronauts fought to be posted to this ship. It would take the Lewis and Clark a thousand years to reach our closest star. The Event Horizon could be there in a day...

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: If it worked.

Speaker: weir
Dialogue: If it worked, yes.

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: I want this room sealed. The Second Containment is off limits.

Speaker: weir
Dialogue: There's no danger. The black hole is contained behind three magnetic fields, it's under control.

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: Your black hole damn near ripped my ship apart. It may have killed one of my men.  No one goes near that thing.

Speaker: peters
Dialogue: Justin...?

Speaker: denny
Dialogue: Mommy...

Speaker: dj
Dialogue: What's wrong?

Speaker: peters
Dialogue: Nothing. It's nothing.

Speaker: cooper
Dialogue: You been out there a long time. Trying to break my record?

Speaker: smith
Dialogue: I'd rather spend the next twelve hours Outside than another five minutes in this can. This ship is bad. It watches you.

Speaker: cooper
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: smith
Dialogue: You heard me. This ship, it's crazy: trying to go faster'n light, that's like the Tower of Babel.

Speaker: cooper
Dialogue: Shit, Smith, you're going Biblical on me.

Speaker: smith
Dialogue: You know what happened to the Tower of Babel, don't you? It fell down.

Speaker: cooper
Dialogue: You're sucking too much nitrogen in your mix.

Speaker: starck
Dialogue: Why Dr. Weir, I think you're in love.

Speaker: weir
Dialogue: Hmmm. Claire used to tell me I loved the Event Horizon more than I loved her. I told her that wasn't true, I just knew the Event Horizon better, that's all.

Speaker: starck
Dialogue: Claire is your wife?

Speaker: weir
Dialogue: Yes.

Speaker: starck
Dialogue: It must be hard, being so far away from her.

Speaker: weir
Dialogue: Yes. I miss her. She died. Two years now.

Speaker: starck
Dialogue: I'm sorry.

Speaker: weir
Dialogue: These things happen.  Wait a minute, that's not right...

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: You have something, Dr. Weir?

Speaker: weir
Dialogue: The date.

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: What about it?

Speaker: weir
Dialogue: The Event Horizon's computer think's

Speaker: weir
Dialogue: Exactly. The ship's internal clock is off by seven years.

Speaker: starck
Dialogue: Maybe a power interruption crashed the system...

Speaker: weir
Dialogue: No, there's no evidence of a surge or spike of any kind. It's as if time just... stopped for seven years.

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: Explanation?

Speaker: weir
Dialogue: Intense gravitational fields effect the passage of time, it's possible...  The Event Horizon has passed beyond our plane of reality, and like Lazarus, returned from the dead.

Speaker: peters
Dialogue: The speaker is the mission commander...

Speaker: weir
Dialogue: John Kilpack.

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: I wonder if they ever made it.

Speaker: kilpack
Dialogue: I just want to say how proud I am of my crew. I'd like to name my station heads Chris Chambers, Janice Rubin, Dick Smith, Tom Fender and Stacie Collins. And to Bill Weir and all the scientists that got us here.

Speaker: kilpack
Dialogue: I... uh, I had something historic to say, and I wrote it down but I... I can't find it. Ave, atque, vale. Hail and farewell.

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: What the hell is that? Dr. Weir?

Speaker: weir
Dialogue: I don't know.

Speaker: peters
Dialogue: I can run the image through a series of filters, try to clean it up.

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: Do it.

Speaker: peters
Dialogue: What's happening...?

Speaker: dj
Dialogue: A power drain --

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: We barely have enough power for life support as it is, if we can't stop the drain, we're not gonna make it.

Speaker: weir
Dialogue: The Core...!

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: Wait!

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: The rest of you, stay here, I don't want anyone else going near that thing.

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: No radiation. What's causing the drain?

Speaker: weir
Dialogue: The magnetic fields are holding. Maybe a short in the fail-safe circuit. I'll check it out.

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: We don't get the power back, our air's gonna go bad.

Speaker: weir
Dialogue: Check the Core for radiation. Carbon dioxide may be the least of our worries.

Speaker: weir
Dialogue: E-three... E-five... E-seven... where are you...

Speaker: starck
Dialogue: What the hell...

Speaker: starck
Dialogue: Skipper, the bio-scan just went off the scale...

Speaker: dj
Dialogue: Justin! Can you hear me? Justin!

Speaker: justin
Dialogue: THE DARK IS COMING...

Speaker: weir
Dialogue: There you are.

Speaker: weir
Dialogue: Um. Captain Miller? I, uh, I seem to have a problem with my light.

Speaker: weir
Dialogue: Captain Miller?

Speaker: voice
Dialogue: Billy.

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: We just lost all power in here. Dr. Weir...?

Speaker: burning man
Dialogue: Don't leave me...

Speaker: weir
Dialogue: Claire...?

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: So cold.

Speaker: dj
Dialogue: Carbon dioxide poisoning produces hallucinations, impaired judgement...

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: Goddammit, DJ, it was not a hallucination! I saw a man, he was on fire. And then he disappeared.

Speaker: starck
Dialogue: Maybe one of the original crew?

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: No. It was someone else.

Speaker: starck
Dialogue: Who?

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: Dr. Weir, you were right there, you must have heard something, seen something...

Speaker: weir
Dialogue: No. I saw nothing.

Speaker: peters
Dialogue: I did.

Speaker: peters
Dialogue: About an hour ago. In medical. I saw my son. He was lying on one of the examination tables and his legs were...

Speaker: weir
Dialogue: Isn't it possible that you were traumatized by finding the body on the bridge?

Speaker: peters
Dialogue: I've seen bodies before. This is different.

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: Peters is right. Its like something reaching into your mind. Seeing your thoughts and making them real. Smith, did you or Cooper experience anything unusual?

Speaker: smith
Dialogue: I didn't see anything and I don't have to see anything. This ship is fucked.

Speaker: weir
Dialogue: Thank you for that scientific analysis, Mister Smith.

Speaker: smith
Dialogue: Hey! You don't need to be a scientist figure it out...

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: Smith...

Speaker: smith
Dialogue: ...you break all the laws of physics, you think there won't be a price? You already killed the first crew...

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: That's enough!

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: DJ!!

Speaker: dj
Dialogue: I'm sorry, I... I don't know why I did that.

Speaker: weir
Dialogue: Carbon dioxide.

Speaker: smith
Dialogue: He's fucking lying, you know something...!

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: That's it, that's enough for one day, Smith! I need you back on the Clark, I need you calm, I need you using your head, you make a mistake out there, none of are getting home, you understand?

Speaker: smith
Dialogue: Sir.

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: Get outside, go back to work. I'll join you shortly.

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: We're a long way from home and we're in a bad place. Let's not make it worse. If anyone has any constructive suggestions, now is the time.

Speaker: weir
Dialogue: I think I can stabilize the fields around the singularity, that should prevent another power drain.

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: Do it.

Speaker: dj
Dialogue: To conserve our oxygen, we should severely restrict our activity. Anyone who can should get some sleep.

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: I don't need sleep, DJ. I need answers.

Speaker: starck
Dialogue: Miller...

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: What is it, Starck?

Speaker: starck
Dialogue: ...I ran the bio-scan with the DNA/RNA filter. The results were bio-readings of indeterminate origin...

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: "...bio-readings of indeterminate origin," don't you have anything useful to tell me?

Speaker: starck
Dialogue: I've got a theory.

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: Go ahead.

Speaker: starck
Dialogue: There was a another surge in the bio- readings right before you... you saw what you saw. We picked up a similar readings right before the Clarke was damaged. What if there were a connection between the two? The gravity waves, the hallucination, all part of an defensive reaction, like an immune system...

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: I don't need to hear this.

Speaker: starck
Dialogue: You've got to listen...

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: To what? What are you saying? This ship is alive?

Speaker: starck
Dialogue: I didn't say that, I said the bio- readings correspond to what happened to you, the ship is reacting to us...

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: We're hanging on by our fingernails and you're giving me bullshit stories...

Speaker: starck
Dialogue: It's not bullshit, it's the only conclusion the data supports...

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: Starck, do you know how crazy that sounds? It's impossible.

Speaker: starck
Dialogue: I know that.

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: If you knew it was impossible, then why'd you waste my time?

Speaker: starck
Dialogue: I thought you wanted an answer. And that's the only one I have.

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: What I want is to survive the next ten hours.

Speaker: starck
Dialogue: Nine hours and twenty-two minutes.

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: I'm going outside to work on the Clark. And Starck... don't tell anyone what you just told me. We've got enough to worry about.

Speaker: peters
Dialogue: Justin...?

Speaker: peters
Dialogue: Justin!

Speaker: dj
Dialogue: What's wrong?

Speaker: peters
Dialogue: You didn't hear it? You must have heard it!

Speaker: starck
Dialogue: Heard what?

Speaker: peters
Dialogue: Oh... nothing...

Speaker: dj
Dialogue: Sit down...

Speaker: peters
Dialogue: Stop it! Stop it!

Speaker: dj
Dialogue: What is it?

Speaker: starck
Dialogue: What are you doing?

Speaker: weir
Dialogue: It wants me. I have to go.

Speaker: starck
Dialogue: In our current environment, Dr. Weir, self-control is an asset.

Speaker: weir
Dialogue: I'm alright. Please.

Speaker: starck
Dialogue: What is it?

Speaker: weir
Dialogue: The forward airlock.

Speaker: starck
Dialogue: Miller, Smith, Cooper, any of you in the airlock?

Speaker: peters
Dialogue: Justin.

Speaker: peters
Dialogue: Justin, no!

Speaker: cooper
Dialogue: We'll have to re-route through the port conduit to the APU.

Speaker: smith
Dialogue: What about the accumulator...?

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: What's going on in there, Starck?

Speaker: starck
Dialogue: He's awake, he's in the airlock, he's not wearing a suit.

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: Stay here! Don't stop working!

Speaker: cooper
Dialogue: But Justin...

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: I'll get him.

Speaker: starck
Dialogue: He's engaged the override.

Speaker: peters
Dialogue: Can you shut it down?

Speaker: starck
Dialogue: I'll try. DJ, you better get your bag of tricks.

Speaker: peters
Dialogue: Justin! Open the door!

Speaker: peters
Dialogue: Open the door!

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: I'm on my way, Starck.

Speaker: peters
Dialogue: The door, Justin! Open the door!

Speaker: justin
Dialogue: Did you hear it?

Speaker: peters
Dialogue: Yes. Yes, Justin, we heard it.

Speaker: starck
Dialogue: Keep him talking.

Speaker: peters
Dialogue: Do you know what it was?

Speaker: justin
Dialogue: It gets inside you. It shows you things... horrible things...

Speaker: justin
Dialogue: ...can't describe it... there are no words...

Speaker: justin
Dialogue: The other crew, they're there, they're waiting for me. They're waiting for you. I won't go back there... I won't...

Speaker: peters
Dialogue: Justin, look at me. Look at me. Open this door.

Speaker: starck
Dialogue: I don't think she can talk him down. We need a sedative.

Speaker: dj
Dialogue: If he opens the outer door he'll turn inside-out.

Speaker: starck
Dialogue: Almost got it.

Speaker: justin
Dialogue: If you could see the things I've seen, you wouldn't try to stop me. You'd come with me.

Speaker: peters
Dialogue: NOOO!

Speaker: computer
Dialogue: Stand-by for decompression. Thirty seconds...

Speaker: justin
Dialogue: Hey, Mama-Bear... what are doing...?

Speaker: justin
Dialogue: Oh my god OH MY GOD...

Speaker: peters
Dialogue: Starck!

Speaker: starck
Dialogue: I can't! The inner door can't open once the outer door has been triggered, it would decompress the entire ship!

Speaker: justin
Dialogue: You gotta open, you gotta stop it, please...

Speaker: peters
Dialogue: We have to do something, oh God...

Speaker: starck
Dialogue: Skipper, Justin just activated the door. It's on a thirty second delay...

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: Patch me through to him.

Speaker: justin
Dialogue: Skipper, you gotta help me...

Speaker: computer
Dialogue: Twenty seconds.

Speaker: justin
Dialogue: ...tell them to open the door...

Speaker: justin
Dialogue: ...I don't want to die...!

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: You're not going to die! Not today! I want you to do exactly as I say and I'm gonna get you out of there, alright?

Speaker: justin
Dialogue: But I can't... I gotta get out of here... Skipper, please...

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: Justin. I won't let you die.

Speaker: justin
Dialogue: Okay... okay...

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: Tuck yourself into a crouched position, shut your eyes as tight as you can!

Speaker: starck
Dialogue: Five seconds.

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: Exhale everything you got, Baby Bear, we can't have any air in those lungs, blow it all out...

Speaker: justin
Dialogue: Oh god --

Speaker: peters
Dialogue: Oh God... Justin...

Speaker: peters
Dialogue: I've got a pulse, he's alive...

Speaker: dj
Dialogue: Pressure?

Speaker: peters
Dialogue: 90 over 50 and falling... .

Speaker: dj
Dialogue: He's crashing...

Speaker: dj
Dialogue: He can breathe. That's good. Let's get him to Medical, go, go!

Speaker: dj
Dialogue: He'll live... if we ever make it back.

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: We'll make it.

Speaker: starck
Dialogue: CO2 levels will reach toxic levels in four hours.

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: Peters. We need to know what happened to the crew. Before it happens to us.

Speaker: peters
Dialogue: I'll get back to the log. But on the bridge, I won't go back, back in there...

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: Thanks.

Speaker: starck
Dialogue: Justin said something about, "The dark inside me..." What did he mean?

Speaker: weir
Dialogue: It means nothing.

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: Is that your "expert opinion?" The only answer we've had out of you is "I don't know."

Speaker: weir
Dialogue: Justin just tried to kill himself. The man is clearly insane.

Speaker: dj
Dialogue: How would you explain your own behavior?

Speaker: weir
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: starck
Dialogue: On the bridge. You said "it" wanted you.

Speaker: weir
Dialogue: I said that?

Speaker: dj
Dialogue: Yes. You did.

Speaker: weir
Dialogue: I don't remember saying that.  Maybe I'm insane, too.

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: I want to know what caused that noise. I want to know why one of my crew tried to throw himself out of the airlock.

Speaker: weir
Dialogue: Thermal changes in the hull could have caused the metal to expand and contract very suddenly, causing reverberations --

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: That's bullshit and you know it! You built this fucking ship and all I've heard from you is bullshit!

Speaker: weir
Dialogue: What do you want me to say?

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: You said this ship creates a gateway...

Speaker: weir
Dialogue: Yes...

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: To what? Where did this ship go? Where did you send it?

Speaker: weir
Dialogue: I don't know...

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: Where has it been for the past seven years?

Speaker: weir
Dialogue: I don't know...

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: The "Other Place," what is that...?

Speaker: weir
Dialogue: I DON'T KNOW!  I don't know. There's a lot of things going on here that I don't understand. Truth takes time.

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: That's exactly what we don't have, Doctor.

Speaker: dj
Dialogue: No. No change.  I've analyzed Justin's blood samples. There's no evidence of excessive levels of carbon dioxide. Or anything else out of ordinary.

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: Of course not. Justin just climbed into the airlock because he felt like it. Just one of those things.  I swore I'd never lose another man. I came close today. Real close.

Speaker: dj
Dialogue: "Another man?" Who?

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: It was on the Goliath. There was this bosun, Corrick, a young guy, a lot like Justin. Edmund Corrick, from Decatur, Georgia. He got caught when the pressure doors sealed, one closed on his arm. Severed it at the wrist. The pain of that must have been... He passed out and...

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: I, I tried to go back for him, to save him, but I couldn't get to him in time. The fire... Have you ever seen fire in zero-gravity? It's like a liquid, it slides over everything. It was like a wave breaking over him, a wave of fire. And then he was gone.  And now you're going to tell me it's carbon dioxide.

Speaker: dj
Dialogue: No.

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: What is it?

Speaker: dj
Dialogue: I've been listening to the transmission. And I think Houston made a mistake in the translation.

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: Go on.

Speaker: dj
Dialogue: They thought it said, "Liberatis me," "Save me," but it's not "me." It's "tutemet:" "Save yourself."

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: It's not a distress call. It's a warning.

Speaker: dj
Dialogue: It gets worse.

Speaker: dj
Dialogue: It's very hard to make out, but listen to this final part.

Speaker: dj
Dialogue: Do you hear it? Right there.

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: Hear what?

Speaker: dj
Dialogue: It sounds like "ex infera:" "ex," from; "infera," the ablative case of "inferi." "Hell."

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: "Save yourself. From Hell."  What are you saying, are you saying that this ship is possessed?

Speaker: dj
Dialogue: No. I don't believe in that sort of thing.  And what it's brought back with it.

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: On my way.

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: Alright, Cooper.

Speaker: cooper
Dialogue: Cross your fingers.

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: You got it, Coop.

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: Back in business.

Speaker: peters
Dialogue: You got any coffee?

Speaker: starck
Dialogue: It's cold.

Speaker: peters
Dialogue: I don't care.

Speaker: peters
Dialogue: Starck...

Speaker: peters
Dialogue: Sweet Jesus. Miller... MILLER!

Speaker: kilpack
Dialogue: Liberatis tutemet ex infera...

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: We're leaving.

Speaker: weir
Dialogue: You can't, your orders are specific...

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: "...to rescue the crew and salvage the ship." The crew is dead, Dr. Weir. This ship killed them. And now it's killing us.

Speaker: weir
Dialogue: You're insane. You've lost your mind.

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: Maybe you're right. But it's still my command, and I have leeway to abort when I feel there is an unacceptable threat to my crew. And I think there is.  Starck, download all the files from the Event Horizon's computers. Coop, Smith, finish moving the CO2 scrubbers back onto the Clark.

Speaker: weir
Dialogue: Don't... don't do this...

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: It's done.

Speaker: smith
Dialogue: What's going on, sweethearts?

Speaker: peters
Dialogue: CO2 scrubbers for the Clark. Miller pulled the plug on the mission.

Speaker: smith
Dialogue: About goddam time.

Speaker: weir
Dialogue: What about my ship?

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: We will take the Lewis and Clark to a safe distance and then launch tac missiles at the Event Horizon until I am satisfied that she has been destroyed.  Fuck this ship.

Speaker: weir
Dialogue: You... You can't do that!

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: Watch me.

Speaker: weir
Dialogue: You can't kill her, I won't let you! I lost her once, I will not lose her again...!

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: Starck, what the hell is going on?

Speaker: starck
Dialogue: We just lost main power again.

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: Goddammit! Starck, get those files and vacate. I want off this ship.

Speaker: weir
Dialogue: You can't leave. She won't let you.

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: Just get your gear back onto the Lewis and Clark, doctor, or you'll find yourself looking for a ride home.

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: Weir? WEIR!

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: All hands. Dr. Weir is missing. I want him found and restrained.

Speaker: smith
Dialogue: Let's go, let's go, this place freaks me out...

Speaker: peters
Dialogue: Last one.

Speaker: peters
Dialogue: Denny?

Speaker: peters
Dialogue: Smith.

Speaker: peters
Dialogue: Denny...?

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: Thank you.

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: Now what?

Speaker: smith
Dialogue: She was right behind me, I turn around, she's gone. She could be anywhere.

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: Alright. Prep the Clark for launch. I'll find her.

Speaker: peters
Dialogue: Denny? Denny, come to Mommy...

Speaker: peters
Dialogue: Hold on, Denny, Mommy's coming...

Speaker: peters
Dialogue: Denny?

Speaker: peters
Dialogue: Denny...?

Speaker: denny
Dialogue: Mommy...

Speaker: peters
Dialogue: You can walk... Denny, you can walk... oh, my baby...

Speaker: denny
Dialogue: Wanna show you, Mommy, wanna show you something...

Speaker: peters
Dialogue: Denny...

Speaker: weir
Dialogue: I won't. I won't leave. This is my ship.

Speaker: weir
Dialogue: Oh no. Peters...?

Speaker: weir
Dialogue: Why did you do that? You didn't have to do that...

Speaker: cooper
Dialogue: Solid as a rock.  Hey, Smith...

Speaker: smith
Dialogue: Roger that.

Speaker: smith
Dialogue: Dr. Weir! Hey, get your ass back on board! Dr. Weir!

Speaker: smith
Dialogue: Skipper, come in...

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: What is it, Smith?

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: Smith, get out of there...

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: One of the explosives is missing from the corridor. I think Weir may have put it on the Clark.

Speaker: smith
Dialogue: No, no, we just got her back together...

Speaker: smith
Dialogue: Where is it, where is it...

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: Smith? Smith! Fuck!

Speaker: smith
Dialogue: I gotcha... I gotcha...

Speaker: smith
Dialogue: I gotcha.

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: NOOO!

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: DJ. The Clark's gone. Smith and Cooper are dead.

Speaker: dj
Dialogue: What happened?

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: DJ, you read me?

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: Peters...

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: Starck, do you read me? Starck...?

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: Son of a bitch!

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: Oh my God.

Speaker: dj
Dialogue: Please...

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: Oh, God, DJ, what do I... how do I...

Speaker: dj
Dialogue: Please... kill...

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: Oh God...

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: Weir.

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: Hold on... Get you outta these...

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: Your eyes...

Speaker: weir
Dialogue: I don't need them anymore. Where we're going, we won't need eyes to see.

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: What are you talking about?

Speaker: weir
Dialogue: Do you know what a singularity is, Miller? Does your mind truly fathom what a black hole is?  It's a liberating experience.

Speaker: computer
Dialogue: Gravity drive primed. Do you wish to engage?

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: What are you doing?

Speaker: computer
Dialogue: Gravity drive engaged. Activation in T-minus ten minutes.

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: If you miss me, you'll blow out the hull. You'll die too.

Speaker: weir
Dialogue: What makes you think I'll miss?

Speaker: starck
Dialogue: Please... help, help me...

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: Give me your hand! Your hand!

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: The forward airlock.

Speaker: starck
Dialogue: Weir can't be alive.

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: Whatever was on that bridge wasn't Weir.

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: Stay behind me.

Speaker: starck
Dialogue: Cooper!

Speaker: cooper
Dialogue: Let me breathe, let me breathe...

Speaker: starck
Dialogue: You're okay now, it's over...

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: It's not over. It's just starting.

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: Weir activated the drive. He's sending us to the Other Place.

Speaker: starck
Dialogue: We've got to shut it down, we've got to...

Speaker: cooper
Dialogue: How? The Bridge is gone.

Speaker: starck
Dialogue: There must be a way! What about Engineering?

Speaker: cooper
Dialogue: Can you shut it down?

Speaker: starck
Dialogue: I don't know the process, Dr. Weir was the expert...

Speaker: cooper
Dialogue: I don't want to go where the last crew went. I'd rather be dead.

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: BLOW THE FUCKER UP.

Speaker: starck
Dialogue: Blow it up?

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: We blow the Corridor. Use the foredecks as a lifeboat, separate it from the rest of the ship. We stay put...

Speaker: cooper
Dialogue: ...and the gravity drive goes where no man has gone before.

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: You prep the gravity couches. I'm going to manually arm those explosives.

Speaker: cooper
Dialogue: Will it work?

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: It worked for Weir. Prep the tanks.

Speaker: starck
Dialogue: I'll do it --

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: No. I'll be right back.

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: Close it behind me. Just in case.

Speaker: starck
Dialogue: Don't be long.

Speaker: cooper
Dialogue: I'm gonna activate the emergency beacon.

Speaker: starck
Dialogue: Hurry.

Speaker: starck
Dialogue: Cooper...!

Speaker: cooper
Dialogue: Starck?

Speaker: cooper
Dialogue: What...?

Speaker: starck
Dialogue: Run!

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: We're armed. This fucker's ready to blow...

Speaker: starck
Dialogue: Miller, he's back, he was in the tank...

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: Slow down, Starck, I can't understand you, who was in the tank?

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: Who? Who?

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: He's dead...

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: You're dead, I saw you die.

Speaker: weir
Dialogue: Weir is dead.

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: Then who the fuck are you?

Speaker: weir
Dialogue: Your fear. Do you remember the Goliath, Miller?

Speaker: burning man
Dialogue: Do you remember me?

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: Corrick...

Speaker: burning man
Dialogue: You left me behind.

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: That's not true...

Speaker: burning man
Dialogue: I begged you. I begged you to save me and you did nothing. You stood there and watched me burn...

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: SHUT UP! SHUT UP!

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: You're not Edmund Corrick.

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: What are you?

Speaker: weir
Dialogue: You know.

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: You want me to believe you're the Devil, well, I don't, that's bullshit!

Speaker: weir
Dialogue: I'm not the Devil.

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: Then what, what are you? Tell me...

Speaker: weir
Dialogue: Better if I just show you.

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: NO!

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: You can't have them!

Speaker: weir
Dialogue: I'm not the Devil. I'm much, much older. I watched the Beginning and I will see the End. I am the dark behind the stars. I am the dark inside you all.

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: ...not the Devil...

Speaker: weir
Dialogue: There is no Devil. There is no God. There is only... NOTHING.

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: You're lying...!

Speaker: weir
Dialogue: I'm not asking you to believe me. You'll see for yourself... and so will your crew. You're all coming with me.

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: Starck... Cooper...

Speaker: weir
Dialogue: They are mine. And so are you...

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: You can't have them. Go to hell.

Speaker: weir
Dialogue: NOOO!

Speaker: starck
Dialogue: Miller...

Speaker: cooper
Dialogue: It's over, hush now, it's over...
